items.title: Semaphore CI: Technical Writer
items.content:
Technical Writer

Posted Feb 7

Semaphore CI
Headquarters: Remote
https://renderedtext.workable.com/jobs/659367/candidates/new

Semaphore is seeking a talented Technical Writer to own the creation and publication of customer-facing product guides and documentation, and contribute to our technical blog.

You'll write for developers and DevOps engineers, and your work will play a vital role in getting customers up and running quickly. Ideally you have both a technical background that enables you to develop examples and a demonstrated ability to deliver high-quality technical documentation that helps customers.

This is a remote position and you should thrive in asynchronous communication. We expect you to be able to develop working relationships with coworkers from around the globe.

You'll collaborate with many teams and continuously use customer feedback to improve Semaphore content.


About Semaphore

SemaphoreCI.com is a leader in hosted continuous integration and deployment, with over 30,000 developers relying on Semaphore to test and deploy their code. Our mission is to help teams ship their software faster and with more confidence by providing a fast, robust and scalable platform for software delivery.

We work in small, highly effective teams, and every person is vital to the success of the company.

Our team is made of smart, creative people who love their craft. We believe that a great place to work is where we're surrounded by self-managed people who consistently do good work and positively inspire us.

We work in a fast-changing environment of a new market, and there are many ways you can make a great impact. You will not be just reaching developers worldwide through great technical content, but have a voice in shaping the company culture too.


Responsibilities

  • Have an in-depth understanding of the product and what customers need to succeed with Semaphore.
  • Work with Marketing team to plan, create and promote new technical blog posts and tutorials related to beginner and advanced CI/CD topics.
  • Work with Engineering teams to ensure features are well documented.
  • Work with Customer Success team to prioritize and fill gaps in existing documentation.
  • Engage with online developer community and use what you learn to guide your work.
  • Review content written by others.

REQUIREMENTS

  • Demonstrated ability to create and manage excellent technical content
  • Be passionate about helping developers solve real problems
  • Ability to quickly grasp complex technical concepts
  • Great teaching skills that translate into amazing written work
  • Working knowledge of open-source programming languages and Docker
  • Be highly organized and self-managed, have excellent work ethic and attention to detail
  • Have the ability to work effectively remotely with a team
  • Residing in time zone CET +/- 4hrs

BENEFITS

  • The impact of working on a product that's competing on a global market
  • Join a small team of around 20 full-time people who love what they do
  • A healthy 40-hour work week, friendly and supportive work environment
  • Competitive salary
  • Company retreats
  • Space to learn continuously and choose the tools and equipment for your job
  • Paid trips to conferences and books of your choice
  • Paid membership at a fitness club of your choice
Semaphore is an equal opportunity employer. Consistent with our mission of serving a diverse and global audience, we value a diverse workforce and inclusive culture which reflects that. We encourage applications from all qualified individuals without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, national origin, marital status, disability, and veteran status.

Apply for this position

Please apply here:https://renderedtext.workable.com/jobs/659367/candidates/new

items.title: Digital Content Producer
items.content:
DESCRIPTION

You’re a Digital content producer who has an enticing way with words and a strong appetite for technology; and you’re looking for a new job. But, not any job. You want a job that empowers you to unleash your creativity, where you are seen as an individual and supported by an equally passionate team.

A role at GrantTree might be exactly what you’ve been looking for.

GrantTree was founded 7 years ago and employs 33 people. In our self-managing culture everyone has the freedom, power and trust to do great work. We call this open culture. It’s been successful for us so far, but we also know it's not for everyone (we suggest you check out our GlassDoor reviews). This is the ideal environment for creative, independent people who are open to developing through challenging work.

GrantTree’s Marketing team is…

Strategic
Creative
High-performing

We've just started to expand our Marketing team and now we’re searching for an additional team member to add richness to our channels through writing content, video production and graphic design.

Could you be this missing person?

REQUIREMENTS

- You are a professional copywriter at core, with experience of independently crafting blog content (within the finance space is a plus).

- You must be passionate and knowledgeable about software, apps and tech. You know how to use the relevant tools to produce supporting quality media assets quickly, an illustration, an infographic or a short animated video of your creation.

- You're confident at reviewing existing content and making executive decisions on how to make it better.

- You are strategic with a sound understanding of your audience and how to best engage them with the right tone of voice.

- You have the ability to build a content strategy and execute it, with an acute attention to detail and performance.

- You enjoy developing editorial guidelines to ensure consistently good writing.

We anticipate that the focus of this role will be around 65% writing and 35% media production. We don't need you to be a full-fledged graphic designer or a videographer, but we expect you to be one of those content producers who use graphic design and video tools to support their content. A deep understanding of how to engage the audience and support core messages is key.

We are looking for someone who will thrive from coordinating their own workload and having free reign to develop content using their expertise. You will also work with the marketing team who can help support you with Strategy, Social Media, SEO and PPC.

In addition to all this, our environment offers the freedom to seriously grow, professionally and personally, helping you gain well-rounded skills to be phenomenal at this role.

BENEFITS

We believe that people should be rewarded fairly for the work they do. At GrantTree there is no secrecy over salaries and the way we work them out. For this role, this is likely to lie between £25k and £35k depending on experience. We also provide access to health insurance, cycle to work, and an annual discretionary bonus.

Aside from money, we offer a place where you can be yourself. We want you to develop your skills and fulfil your potential. We have a flexible approach to working, and some of our staff work remotely most of the time. Our office near Old Street is bright and airy, with a fab roof terrace. You can take up to 6 weeks as holiday each year.

Equal Opportunities

Teams are stronger when they have a diverse range of people. Applications are accepted from everyone, regardless of the categories they put themselves in. We also encourage talented ‘square pegs’, who don’t neatly fit into the person specification, to apply.

items.title: The Art of Applying: Coach & Editor for Grad School Admissions Bootcamp
items.content:
Coach & Editor for Grad School Admissions Bootcamp

Posted Feb 3

The Art of Applying
Headquarters: New York, NY (formerly Austin, TX)
http://theartofapplying.com/teach

Write, Teach, Edit, Encourage, and Coach Grad School Applicants to Success


Position: Full-Time Instructor & Coach for The Art of Applying's Application Accelerator program (full-time remote employment)

Compensation: $50,000-$70,000 + bonuses for achieving outstanding client results 

Note: Compensation is comprised of $36,000 base pay + variable pay based on number of clients you work directly with as their primary instructor. Bonuses for achieving outstanding client results are in addition to figures listed above.

The $50,000 figure is the approximate pay for working with 5 new clients per month; the $70,000 figure is the approximate pay for working with 10 new clients per month. Because graduate admissions is very seasonal, the workload varies throughout the year with 5 being on the low side of new clients per month.

Vacation: 10 paid vacation days 

Work hours: Monday - Friday 10 am - 7 pm Eastern with a one-hour unpaid lunch (there is room for some flexibility with the hours, but these are primarily the required hours)

Location: Remote (must be located in the United States or Canada)

Deadline to apply: Thursday, February 8, 2018 at 11:00 pm Eastern

Start Date: Thursday, March 1, 2018 at the very latest

The Art of Applying is a fast-growing education company founded by a woman Harvard MBA & MPA graduate that helps people from all over the world get admitted to their dream graduate schools with funding to pay for it.

We’re looking for an enthusiastic, reliable, encouraging, outgoing graduate degree holder with excellent communication skills, outstanding essay and resume editing skills, and a love for storytelling, teaching and learning to join our 100% remote team (yes, you’d get to work from home!) as the first Full-Time Faculty Member for our Application Accelerator, a bootcamp for high-achieving high-potential applicants to Ivy League MBA, MPP, JD, M.Ed., MSW, Engineering, Data Science, and Design programs.

As the full-time instructor, you will serve as the primary coach and point person for a caseload of 5-10 new clients per month who are applying to their dream schools and scholarships. You will teach and reinforce the tested system and curriculum our founder has created, review submitted homework of your clients, hold online office hours, edit your clients' materials, and support your clients to success in getting into their dream schools with substantial scholarship funding.

Right now, our goal is to hire two outstanding full-time instructors and to add more instructors as needed.

How would you like to be with a company that helps people get into their dream graduate schools with funding that is at the very beginning of a significant growth phase?

A company that is willing and able to thoroughly train you, give you the curriculum to teach, and show you everything you need to know to succeed?

A company that is more concerned about your passion and potential than about your job history or your experience?

A company that has twice-yearly all expenses paid company retreats? Our last retreat was in Austin, Texas and included beating a difficult Escape Game, a dessert reception with some of our clients, touring the city, one-hour massages, and eating the world’s best BBQ. Yeehaw!

With hard work and a willingness to learn, you will have the opportunity to build your skills, contribute to an amazing mission, have fun with like-minded people, and do it all while working from home.

Requirements:

  • Masters degree or PhD—the more prestigious the school the better
  • experience teaching, coaching, and/or tutoring in a 1-on-1 and group environment
  • excellent communication skills
  • outstanding editing skills
  • strong writing skills
  • engaging, encouraging teaching style
  • ability to keep client information strictly confidential
  • comfortable with technology; willing to learn how to use Zoom, Basecamp, Helpscout, Gmail, Google Sheets, and Google Docs
  • available to work 40 hours per week

Primary job duties:

  • meet weekly with CEO to update her on client progress
  • hold weekly office hours for 2-3 consecutive hours for clients to live edit client materials and have clients come and ask you questions about their application process
  • hold monthly office hours for 2-3 consecutive hours for clients who have graduated from the bootcamp but still have lingering questions or concerns
  • edit approximately 20k - 50k words of multiple drafts of essays, resumes, and other application content for each client you work with (editing happens over multiple months and is intense around MBA deadlines in August, November, and December).
  • conduct 1-on-1 coaching calls with clients and keep notes on coaching calls
  • conduct mock interviews with clients to help them prepare for admissions interviews
  • answer client questions about their application process via the client portal system
  • propose ideas to CEO on how to improve the experience for our clients
  • propose, create, and teach additional modules for the bootcamp curriculum
  • write blog posts about graduate admissions and highlighting client success stories

Who we aren’t looking for:
  • people afraid of technology or who are proud to be “not computer savvy”
  • people interested in a remote role so they can travel several months out of the year
  • people who want to start their own business or build their own brand
  • people looking to make quick cash on the side. We're building a long-term team as we scale, and want people who are interested in building a career here.

Apply for this position

http://theartofapplying.com/teach

items.title: Legalcom: Editor of Content
items.content:
Editor of Content

Posted Jan 30

Legalcom
Headquarters: EU/US
https://legalcom.group

We’re looking for a reliable, talented editor who loves creating high-quality content.

We work with a remote team of freelance writers in dozens of countries all over the world and we are looking for an editor to review, edit and manage our content:

  • Review and edit articles written by our freelance writers. Work with writers to achieve high-quality articles.
  • Propose topic ideas
  • Manage the editorial calendar
  • And so on

About The Work

The work entails:

  • Manage freelancers writers, starting from replying to their job applications to bringing them on board.
  • Propose article topics for writers to write about based on collaboration with SEO manager.
  • Write blog posts and marketing copy to promote our products and services
  • Proofread, re-structure and edit articles by content writers
  • Update our website and social media pages with new content
  • Craft and send our monthly newsletter
  • Interview industry professionals and use online sources to research topics
  • Improve illustration in collaboration with marketing and design teams
  • Optimize published pieces using SEO guidelines
  • Manage the editorial calendar and ensure timely publication
  • Generate new ideas around industry-related topics 

Job Requirements

  • Native English speaker with strong writing skills. We can make an exception on this if you have an English Proficiency qualification.
  • Exceptional online research skills
  • Well organized & rock steady reliable
  • SEO knowledge

It’s a major plus if you have any of the following skills:

  • Legal degree or paralegal experience
  • Some degree of technical proficiency: working knowledge of HTML and WordPress.

How Do We Work?

We work remotely. We generally don’t need to sync time zones. The tools we use to collaborate are:

  • Gmail
  • Google Suite
  • Basecamp

How to Apply

Please send an email to office@legalcom.group with:

- A 4-5 sentence introduction explaining why you think you would be a good fit.
- 3 URLs showcasing your work related to internet laws or technology.
- Your desired monthly pay or hourly rate. We’ll work on a 2-weeks to a 1-month trial period at first.

Please format your subject line as follows: Your Name | Editor of Content | WeWorkRemotely (example: John Doe | Editor of Content | WeWorkRemotely)

Apply for this position

Please see above "How to Apply".

items.content:
Senior Writer

Posted Jan 11

Aha!
Headquarters: United States
https://www.aha.io/company/careers/current-openings/technical_support_writer_us

Do you love writing about how people innovate and build winning products? Does double-spacing make your eye twitch? We are looking for a self-starter with proven editorial and technical chops. Someone who can bring both big-picture pitches and eagle-eyed attention to detail — with a product management angle. If this is you, we want to hear from you!

As a Senior Writer at Aha!, you will have an excellent opportunity to join a breakthrough and profitable company that is growing fast. Aha! was founded by a proven team of Silicon Valley veterans whose last two businesses were acquired by well-known public companies. More than 150,000 users trust Aha! to link their brilliant strategy to their team's work and create visual roadmaps.

We are looking for someone who:
  • Has experience in a B2B SaaS or technology company
  • Has deep experience in and knowledge of product management
  • Writes exceptionally well (and has the clips to prove it)
  • Has proven research skills
  • Dreams about the best way to tell a story
  • Has a deep interest in a diverse mix of content topics, including but not limited to: product management, software development, innovation, and startups
  • Is bold, likes to interact with customers, and takes on increasing levels of responsibility

    We are committed to being great, and we want someone who:
    • Can work at a fast-paced company where the feedback cycle is measured in hours rather than weeks
    • Has a "can do" attitude and a background of delivering superb work again and again
    • Is seeking a career-defining opportunity and a proven, results-oriented team which has sold multiple software companies

    We are building a distributed team, and you can work from anywhere in the United States for this role. We offer generous salary, equity, benefits, and a profit-sharing program.

    For immediate consideration, please follow these helpful guidelines and contact us at Marketing-jobs@aha.io. If you have the right background, we will quickly follow up with you. We are not working with recruiters or third-party agencies.

    Apply for this position

    Please send resume and cover letter to: Marketing-jobs@aha.io

items.content:
Fashion Copywriter at ONYCHEK

New York City, Remote · Internship
Skills
Content Management, Ecommerce, Online Marketing and Copywriting, Content Marketing, Copy Writing and Editing, Fashion Journalism, Experience Luxury Beauty/Fashion Industry, Product Description
Compensation
$8K–$10K
No Equity
Visa Sponsorship
Not available

Job Description

Are you interested in working for a fashion startup? Are you interested in an opportunity for you to make a great impact from Day 1 of the company launching? We are looking for a paid fashion copywriter intern, who is interested in the infusion of African luxury fashion and amazing content.

Our team is very keen in identifying topics and stories that appeal to our audience. We create and distribute content that helps establish ONYCHEK Blog, THEINSIGHT, as a trusted source of African luxury fashion information, inspiration, and commerce. A successful candidate would enjoy writing marketing content for fashion topics such as culture, styling tips, fabrics, "how to" and history.

This internship position will work directly with the CEO and content creator lead in coordinating content production.

About ONYCHEK

ONYCHEK.com is a New York based African Luxury Fashion ecommerce startup. We are making African Luxury Fashion easily accessible to the world.

Responsibilities

Write content for the ONYCHEK blog, product descriptions, and our social media handles
Research, write, and/or edit many other types of content, which could include: emails, articles, social media posts, editorials, presentations, emails, and web copy
Work with team members to brainstorm, develop, create, and promote content that appeals to our global audience
Help manage and maintain all the behind-the-scenes systems and processes that keep us running well: editorial calendars, content inventories, analytics, etc.

Requirements
Ability to turn ideas into compelling concepts/copy
Ability to flexibly adapt your writing style to our audience
Strong editing and proofreading skills
Experience working in customer service is a plus
Experience with Photoshop, Google Analytics, HTML, video editing, social media marketing is a major plus

Characteristics
Passion for the written word, creativity, and content marketing
Demonstrated aptitude for storytelling
Entrepreneurial, team player
Excitement for all aspects of content development - idea generation, research, writing, gathering input and buy in, editing, collaborating with web designer/developer. For watching your work make impact
A healthy respect for deadlines, and the drive to see projects through to completion
Motivated to learn new skills and disciplines
Self motivated/ self starter
Willing to try new things
HTML and CSS experience will be helpful

What You Will Learn:
The ability to move fast in decision making
Growing a fashion startup
Wearing different hats at the same time
Quick reiteration

Details:
Candidate should be willing to work between 10-20 hours a week and can be remote.

Please send resume to team@onychek.com

items.title: SiteGround: English Content Writer - Remote
items.content:
English Content Writer - Remote

Posted Dec 6

SiteGround
Headquarters: Sofia, Bulgaria
https://www.siteground.com/careers

About You

You love the written word, it’s an artform to you that allows you to explain how technical products solve people's problems. You’re the person who corrects others’ grammar and spelling, because grammar and spelling are really important (people who don’t think that need their head read). You’re sensitive about the Oxford comma?
 
You’ve also got some experience with websites, which could be as simple as setting up your own WordPress blog or as advanced as doing some PHP development in your own time.

You want to work remotely and you’re looking for the perfect job that doesn’t restrict you to one place.

If you’ve been nodding your head to all of the above, read on.

About Us

We’re a team of technical, service and marketing experts who believe in helping customers leverage technology to get better results for their business. Our main service is web hosting, and we’re really good at it. So good, in fact, we’re one of the only 3 web hosts worldwide recommended by WordPress.org.

SiteGround was founded in Bulgaria in 2004 and sell to clients all over the world. Today we have 5 offices between Bulgaria and Spain, five data centers on 3 continents and host over 800 0000 domains. Due to our continuous growth we are are looking for writers and content experts to build our content team.

The Role

Working for the brand manager, you’ll be helping craft content for different market segments, speaking their language and clearly communicating what they need to know to help them run their online business or hobby better.

You’ll be writing articles, producing ebooks, and refining social media posts on a daily basis.

Requirements

The most important thing is you share our values of Craftsmanship, Quality, Passion, and a sense of Fun. You’ll have to demonstrate each of these in your application.

You have 2+ years of experience writing content, and have the examples to prove it along with stats to show reach and engagement with the target audience.

Benefits

  • Work anywhere in the world, as long as you have 4 hours overlap with Eastern Europe office hours (GMT+3);
  • Permanent contract;
  • Young and friendly team of professionals;
  • Informal and fun working culture;
  • Macbook workstation;
  • Annual Remote Team Building.

If you are interested, please send to jobs@siteground.com your CV and a piece of content explaining why you are the ideal person. We get lots of applications for these types of roles, so make sure you stand out.

Please note: Due to the volume of applications only shortlisted candidates will be contacted for further steps.

Apply for this position

Send to jobs@siteground.com your CV and a piece of content explaining why you are the ideal person.

items.title: Content, Community, Social and Marketing, and more
items.content:
Content, Community, Social and Marketing, and more at Around.io

Bengaluru, Remote · Full Time
Compensation
₹400K–₹700K
No Equity

Job Description

I am looking for someone who understands (online) community management, understands basics of inbound marketing, can handle social media, and who can may be write.

Its an amazing opportunity to be face of the company in front of thousands of small businesses across the world.

Lets break it down:

- If you know basics of all the things above and are willing to learn, I am interested in talking to you

- I (& rest of marketing team) will be there every step of the way to help out

- I can assure great learning, and awesome work environment

- We are startup friendly startup, which means, later on if you wish to move on or want to start your own, I will be more than happy to help

- If you want to know what early stage startups goes through on a regular basis, this is THE place to be, we are breaking things (features on website), shipping code daily and living on sine wave (not sure what this means? Contact me :) )

- I believe in taking risks and running experiments, so if you come up with ridiculous ideas (on face of them), I am always ready to test them

- Data is the only truth that we live by, or I should say we try to live by, no opinion (mine or anyone else’s) is bigger than what data says

- Just to make it clear, I do not see this role as a part time role or temporary role, I see this as integral part of my CORE team and intend to keep it that way

If you like to work with artists, crafters, online sellers, merchants, and like to see them succeed, this is a place where you can learn a lot and enjoy at the same time.

I am happy to answer any questions you might have..
